div.ab: Even though you cast in lead, the molds want to be well dried, especially when they are large, and one needs to redden them on the outside & keep them in continuous heat until they no longer smoke from inside. Do not place them to reheat at different times, but continue once you have started. And do not place them to cool in the cold, With for they would crack, but leave them to become lukewarm near the fire, & when they are still of such a heat as you have noticed before by putting your finger in the hole, cast. And when the mold is large, it needs more time to reheat & dry, & one needs to cast hotter.
